summary: A SEMI TRACTOR PULLING A FLAT BED TRAILER LOST TWO IMPROPERLY SECURED 4X4-7FT DUNNAGE WHEN A FAULTY (WORN-OUT) BUNGE COARD SECURING THE LOAD BROKE. THE TWO TIMBERS , ONE FLEW OVER MY VEHICLE WHILE THE OTHER HIT THE PAVEMENT IN FRONT OF MY VEHICLE WHICH I HAD TO RUN OVER BREAKING IT INTO MANY PIECES. LUCKILY THE ONLY DAMAGE I CAN ASCERTAIN TO MY VEHICLE AT THIS TIME IS DAMAGE TO THE DEFLECTOR BELOW THE FRONT BUMPER. THIS WAS NOT NOTICED UNTIL I ARRIVED HOME IN TULSA, OK.  I TRIED TO CONTACT THE COMPANY LISTED ON THE TRACTOR DOOR. THERE WAS NO TELEPHONE LISTING FOR THE COMPANY LISTED, THEREFORE I GIVE YOU THIS PERTINENT INFORMATION.              COMPANY: RCP TRUCKING                               HORATIO, AR.                               ICCMC 432490                               USDOT 283898                  TRACTOR # 148                TRAILER # 37                DRIVER: KEVIN (NO TEL # OR COMPANY ADDRESS WAS AVAILABLE FROM THE                                        DRIVER.)   MY OBSERVATION OF THE EQUIPMENT REVEALED BALD TIRES ON THE DRIVE WHEELS AND THE TRAILER IN A CONDITION OF DISREPAIR. THIS EQUIPMENT SHOULD BE REMOVED FROM SERVICE UNTIL PLACED IN A SAFE OPERATING CONDITION.    I CONSIDER MYSELF TO BE VERY LUCKY THAT I WAS NOT SEVERELY INJURED OR KILLED.     PLEASE RESPOND WITH ANY INFORMATION YOU CAN PROVIDE ME CONCERNING THIS TRUCKING COMPANY.     THANK YOU FOR YOUR PROMPT ATTENTION IN THIS MATTER.    CALVIN NICKOLS     *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1998 RANGER TRAILER (NA).  WHILE PULLING THE TRAILER AT 30 MPH, THE DRIVER SIDE TREAD SEPARATED FROM THE TIRE.  THE TIRE WAS NOT FLAT.  THE TIRE WAS A MAXXIS RADIAL M8008 (NA).  THE CONTACT HAS PICTURES.  NO OTHER VEHICLE INFORMATION WAS AVAILABLE.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 1,000.

BOUGHT  THE TRUCK IN 2005,  IT WAS A 98 DODGE RAM 1500, AND  IT HAD A PERFECT DASHBOARD  ON IT. NOW IN 2007 THE DASHB OARD   CRACKED.  HAD NO WRECKS ON RECORD.  IM AFRAID IT MIGHT DEPLOY MY AIRBAG OR KEEP CRACKN OFF. I DISN'T  HAVE A NEW ONE YET BUT I WOULD APPRECIATE IT IF YOU INVESTIGATE THIS PROBLEM. THANK YOU.  AK

WINDSHIELD WIPERS FAILED IN THE RAIN, MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO SEE THE ROAD. VEHICLE WAS TAKEN FOR CHECK UP, AND FOUND THAT THERE WAS A RECALL 03V159000 FOR THE 1997 YEAR, MAKE, AND MODEL. *AK. CIRCUIT BOARD ON WINDSHIELD WIPER FAILED-SAME PART AND PROBABLY W/RECALLED VEHICLES. NEW ONE COST $54.00. WHY WAS RECALL NOT EXTENDED TO ALL VEHICLES WITH THIS DEFECTIVE CIRCUIT BOARD. *JB
SUNROOF DRAINS INEFFECTIVE. END TUBES NOT LARGE ENOUGH, SHAPED LIKE A CONE WITH SLATS. CAUSES SUNROOF TO LEAK INSIDE CAR.  *NM

AXLE BRAKES ON 5TH WHEEL TRAILER ARE POSSIBLY DEFECTIVE.   *MR    ONLY 2 OF THE 6 BRAKES WORKED.  THE DEALER SUGGESTED THAT THE AXLE'S WERE KNOWN TO HAVE DEFECTIVE SPRINGS.  THE DEALER CHECKED THE BRAKES BUT DID NOT TAKE THE WHEELS OFF.  (MOUNTAINAIR TR COACH)   *SC  *JB

NUMEROUS CONCERNS INVOLVING 1998 UVL 603A SYSTEM.   *MR   THE CONSUMER WAS OPERATING THE LIFT AND DUE TO THE LACK OF SENSORS AND OR THE MICRO SWITCHES, THE LACK OF LIGHTING, POSSIBILITY OF INJURY ON THE DOOR STEP, AND THE INABILITY TO SECURE THE SIDE DOORS WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION, THE DOOR FELL AND CAUSED INJURY TO THE CONSUMERS DAUGHTER AT THE END OF THE LIFT.  (THE BARRIER OPENED AT THE END OF THE RACK AND ALLOWED THE ACCIDENT TO OCCUR)  THE CONSUMER EXPERIENCED SEVERAL INCIDENTS WHERE THE DOOR WOULD OPEN WHILE THE VEHICLE WAS IN MOTION AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS.   *SC

1998 SUNNYBROOK 33' 5TH WHEEL TRAILER 10500 LBS  THE FRAME SUPPORTING THE PIN BOX HAS SEVERAL FRACTURES AND TEARS IN THE STEEL FRAME. SHOULD IT SEPARATE FROM THE TOW VEHICLE IT WOULD PULL OUT THE ELECT BREAK-AWAY SWITCH. THERE WOULD BE FATALITIES & EXTENSTIVE PROPERTY DAMAGE. I HAVE NOTIFIED THE MAKER, SENT PICTURES, NO RESPONCE. THIS TRAILER WEIGHTS OVER 10,000 POUNDS AND IS 33' LONG.  *AK
GOODYEAR WRANGLER HT LT235/85R16E  DOT MKOR-HTOV-297  SUDDEN TREAD SEPARATION AT HIGHWAY SPEED.  *JB

R4S LT22575R16  DOTVN1L1XD137, REPLACEMENT TIRES ON A 29FT., CARRIAGE TRAVEL TRAILER 5TH WHEEL 1998.  CONSUMER STATES THAT THE TREAD COMPLETELY SEPERATED FROM THE PASSENGER SIDE FRONT TIRE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO FIRESTONE, FIRESTONE STATED THAT THE TIRE WAS UNDER INFLATED.  CONSUMER STATED THAT THIS WAS NOT TRUE.  THE CONSUMER HAS REPLACED THE SAME TIRE ON THREE SEPERATED OCASIONS.  MR  SCC

TIRE BLEW OUTON CASITA, TRAILER ON NOMRAL LOAD.  TIRE HAD FEW MILES, WAS STORED PROPERLY (OUT OF SUNLIGHT).  OWNERS WEB SITE INDICATES THAT THIS BRAND FAILS OFTEN, MANY TIMES GREATER THAN OTHER BRANDS.  NLM

IN LESS THAN 300 MILES I HAVE HAD THREE TIRE FAILURES (TREAD SEPARATING FROM THE TIRE BODY).  IN TWO OF THE CASES I WAS MOVING AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS AND IN THE OTHER I FOUND THE TREAD SEPARATION DURING NORMAL INSPECTION.  TIRE FAILURE ON AN RV COULD CAUSE VERY SERIOUS ACCIDENTS SHOULD THE RV SERVE OR TURNOVER CAUSING THE TOW VEHICLE DRIVER TO LOSE CONTROL.*AK

ALL LATE MODELS WITH "RATCHETING" REAR SEAT BELTS DESIGNED TO SECURE CHILD SEATS. I AM AN ASE CERTIFIED MASTER AUTO TECHNICIAN & FORMAN AT A MULTI CAR LINE NEW CAR DEALER. I HAVE SEEN THIS PROBLEM ON THREE SEPARATE INCIDENTS, ALL DIFFERENT MAKES & MODELS.  IF SHOULDER BELT BECOMES WRAPED AROUND A CHILDS NECK,  AFTER BEING FULLY EXTENDED, COULD CAUSE STRANGULATION!*AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

DISCS ON MOTORCYCLES HAVE A KNOWN HISTORY OF SEVERE WARPING.  THE FIRST TIME MINE WARPED BADLY ENOUGH TO BE DANGEROUS.  DEALER TOOK A LONG TIME TO CONVINCE MOTOR GUZZI TO REPLACE THE ROTOR UNDER WARRANTY.  THE REPLACEMENT ROTOR IS NOW WARPED BADLY ENOUGH TO BE DANGEROUS, BUT THE BIKE IS OUT OF WARRANTY.  MOTO GUZZI KNOWS ABOUT THE BRAKE ROTOR WARPING BEING AN ONGOING PROBLEM, AND YET CONTINUES TO SUPPLY THE SAME DEFECTIVE PARTS, AND EITHER REFUSE TO REPLACE WARPED ROTORS OR REPLACE THEM THE SAME DEFECTIVE PARTS.*AK
COMPLETE TIRE SEPARATION WITHOUT ANY WARNING WHILE DRIVING - HAVE 5 OF THE SAME TIRES ON TRAILER, WHICH INCLUDES THE SPARE TIRE.*AK (TIRESIZE: 225/15R)
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOV EVEHICLE. *AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOV EVEHICLE. *AK

THE GO-PED IS A MOTORIZED SCOOTER ALLOWED ON CALIFORNIA ROADS, WHICH DOES NOT HAVE DOT TIRES AND BRAKES. ITS SMALL TIRES MAKE IT INHERENTLY UNSTABLE AND THE BRAKE DESIGN TEND TO FAIL. THIS MOTOR VEHICLE SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED ON ROADS WITHOUT MEETING THE DOT MINIMUM SAFETY STANDARDS FOR TIRES AND BRAKES. *AK

THE GO-PED IS A MOTORIZED SCOOTER ALLOWED ON CALIFORNIA ROADS, WHICH DOES NOT HAVE DOT TIRES AND BRAKES. ITS SMALL TIRES MAKE IT INHERENTLY UNSTABLE AND THE BRAKE DESIGN TEND TO FAIL. THIS MOTOR VEHICLE SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED ON ROADS WITHOUT MEETING THE DOT MINIMUM SAFETY STANDARDS FOR TIRES AND BRAKES. *AK

ENGINE DIES AFTER CLIMBING A  HILL IN VERY HOT WEATHER (95+) & MOSTLY HIGHER ELEVATION (4000' +), IT IS VERY HARD TO STOP VEHICLE WITHOUT POWER STEERING & BRAKES WHEN ENGINE DIES !! ENGINE ALWAYS STARTS AFTER 10 TO 30 MINUTE WAIT, BUT BY THE TIME (50 + MILES) YOU CAN GET IT TO A DEALER THEY CAN NOT FIND ANY CAUSE OF PROBLEM !! THIS YEAR WE ALMOST HAD SERIOUS ACCIDENT AFTER CLIMING THE 16 MILE HILL OUTSIDE OF BAKER, CA. , A 18 WHEELER HAD TO APPLY ALL BRAKES TO MISS US IN VERY HEAVY TRAFFIC & IN LAS VEGAS WE HAD TO SLOW TO MAKE A LANE CHANGE IN 3 PM TRAFFIC , THE ENGINE DIED - WE SAT FOR 10 MINUTES WITH FLASHERS ON BEFORE IT WOULD START !!  IT HAPPENED (4) TIMES IN 1998, (2) 1999,  (7) 2000,(5) 2001 !!*AK
THE CAR WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE DEALER 3 TIMES IN 13 MONTHS FOR THE SEAT BELT LIGHT SENSOR IN THE DASH WAS ON. I HAD A FRONTAL COLLISION AT A SPEED OF ABOUT 50-55 MPH, AND NO AIR BAGS DEPLOYED.  *AK

7-17-2000 TIRE BLEW OUT AND HAD TREAD SEPARATION. TIRE REPLACEMENT COST $60. 8-27-2000 TIRE HAD TREAD SEPARATION WHILE DOING 60 MPH ON ROUTE 80 IN OHIO. CAUSED $1000 IN BODY DAMAGE IN ADDITION TO HAVING TO PAY $80 TO GET TIRE REPLACED.  5-28-2001 TIRE HAD TREAD SEPARATION WHILE DOING 60 MPH ON ROUTE 295 IN NEW JERSEY. CAUSED APPROX. $2000 IN BODY DAMAGE.  I HAVE NOT REPLACED TIRE YET.  THE BODY DAMAGE OCCURRED BECAUSE AS THE TREAD WAS PEELING OFF THE TIRE, IT WAS BEATING AGAINST THE SIDE OF THE TRAILER.  *AK (DOT NUMBER: M5HV047  TIRESIZE: LT235/85R1)

FIRST TIRE FAILED @ABOUT 39000 MILES,ON RIGHT FRONT WHEEL.ANEW TIRE SANE MAKE AND MODEL WAS INSTALLED . WE DROVE ABOUT 1700 MILES, AND THE NEW TIRE FAILED, DOT #B6BJBVJX0200. ABOUT 800 MILES LATER THE RIGHT REAR INNER TIRE FAILED# B6BJBVX517. AFTER ALL THIS WE REPLACED ALL THE TIRES ON THE MOTOR HOME WITH A HIGHER LOAD RATING . THE MOTOR HOME WAS WEIGHED EVERY YEAR YEAR ON CERTIFIED TRUCK SCALES AND IT WAS WELL UNDER THE MAXIMUM LOAD RATING FOR 100 PSI PRESSURE.LOOKING AT THE TIRES THE SIDE WALL WIRE PLYS ALL WERE RUSTED. WE HAD WHAT SERVICE MEN CALLED ZIPPER SPLITS.*AK (DOT NUMBER: B6JBVTX517  TIRESIZE: 235/80R22.)
TRITAN MODEL # 9/3/98SET UP FILE, NEW REFERRAL. NO SAFETY DEFECT.

TIRES CHECKED FOR AIR PRESSURE WITHIN 100 AND 500 MILES OF DISINTEGRATION.  HAVE CARCASS OF FIRST AND TREAD AND CARCASS OF SECOND.  USING THIRD ORIGINAL AS A SPARE.  CONTACTED DUNLOP - BRUSHED OFF.  CONTACTED TRAILMANOR - THEY QUIT USING DUNLOP BECAUSE OF FAILURES.  WITH TWO OF THREE TIRES FAILING, I FEEL THERE MIGHT BE A SAFETY ISSUE.*AK (DOT NUMBER: (CR1153-2)  TIRESIZE: 205/75R14)

NO EVIDENCE OF UNDERINFLATION OR ROAD HAZARD. BOTH READILY REPLACED BY FIRESTONE SERVICE CENTER, 20707 AVALON BLVD. CARSON, CA. 90746.*AK (TIRESIZE: 24575R16)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: 24575R16 )

THE AXLES ON THE TRAILER ARE MOVED BACK TOO FAR SUCH THAT THE TONGUE WEIGHT OF THE TRAILER WHEN UNLOADED IS CLOSE TO OR EXCEEDS 1000 POUNDS. THE STANDARD HITCH AND RECEIVER ASSEMBLY ON NEW AUTOMOBILE'S HAS A 1000 POUND TONGUE WEIGHT. WHEN THE TRAILER IS NORMALLY LOADED, THE TONGUE WEIGHT EXCEEDS 1200 POUNDS.  IN ADDITION, THE 50 GALLON FRESH WATER TANK IS AS FAR FORWARD AS POSSIBLE IN THE TRAILER.  WHEN FULL, THIS ADDS MORE THAN 400 POUNDS TO THE TONGUE WEIGHT BRINGING THE TOTAL WEIGHT ON THE HITCH EXCEEDS OF 1600 POUNDS.  THE MANUFACTURER PROVIDES NO WARNING ON THIS POTENTIAL HAZARD.  THIS PROBLEM COULD CAUSE A CATASTROPHIC FAILURE OF EITHER THE HITCH, RECEIVER, OR AXLES OF SOME VEHICLES BECAUSE THIS ALSO CAN CAUSE THE GROSS AXLE WEIGHT LIMIT TO BE EXCEEDED ON MANY TOW VEHICLE.  WANDERER STOPPED PRODUCING THIS TRAILER MODEL, PROBABLY DUE TO THIS HAZARD, THOUGH THEY CONTINUE TO INSIST THERE IS NO PROBLEM AND WILL NOT PROVIDED ANY WARNING TO CONSUMERS.  *MR   *JB      DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS---731264

THIS INFANT CAR SEAT HAS A CANOPY THAT PROTECTS INFANT FROM SUN. THE CANOPY IS REMOVABLE, BUT WHERE THE CANOPY ATTACHES TO THE CAR SEAT HAS BECOME WORN.  BECAUSE OF THE WEAR ON THE PLASTIC, THE HOLE WHERE THE CANOPY CONNECTS TO THE CAR SEAT IS BIGGER THAN SHOULD BE CAUSING THE CANOPY TO NOT STAY SECURE AT ITS ATTACHMENT.  THE CANOPY HAS SEVERAL TIMES BEEN LAYING ON TOP OF MY INFANTS FACE.  THE PROBLEM HAS BEEN JUST ON ONE SIDE WHERE IT'S ATTACHED, BUT BOTH SIDES ARE VERY LOOSE.  MY NEIGHBOR HAS THE SAME CAR SEAT AND HAS COMPLAINED TO ME REGARDING THE SAME PROBLEM.  I HAVE OWNED THIS CAR SEAT FOR  2 YEARS NOW.

AUTO ACCIDENT, VAN ROLLED SEVERAL  TIMES, ALSO CAME IN CONTACT  WITH ANOTHER VEHICHLE, AIR BAGS NEVER WORKED.  WHAT DO YOU HAVE  TO DO TO MAKE ONE WORK???  MY  FATHER WAS KILLED  IN THIS ACCIDENT AND I DON'T  UNDERSTAND WHY THE AIRBAGS WOULD NOT HAVE  WORKED.*AK

I PURCHASED 2 CENTURY NEXT STEP CAR/BOOSTER SEATS.  WE HAVE BEEN USING THEM AS A BOOSTER SEAT FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 YEAR.  FOR A WHILE NOW, THE BRACKET THAT HOLDS THE SEAT BELT IN PLACE HAS BEEN SLIPPING OUT OF THE LOOPS THAT ARE SUPPOSED TO HOLD IT WHILE MY SON IS NOT IN THE SEAT, ALTHOUGH I NOTICED IT SLIPPING OUT ONE TIME WHILE HE WAS SITTING IN IT.  I CALLED CENTURY TODAY TO REPORT THE PROBLEM, AND THEY TOLD ME IT REQUIRED A WHOLE NEW PAD BECAUSE THEY DON'T SELL THE BRACKET SEPARATELY, AND THEY ATTEMPTED TO FORCE ME TO BUY IT BECAUSE MY SEAT WAS OUT OF WARRANTY.  I COMPLAINED VEHEMENTLY THAT THIS WAS CLEARLY A DESIGN DEFECT WITH THE SEAT, SINCE IT HAPPENED WITH BOTH OF THEM IN TWO DIFFERENT CARS, AND THEY GAVE IN AND ARE SENDING ME THE PADS FOR A SHIPPING FEE.  I AM SURE THEY ARE NOT REPORTING THIS PROBLEM, SO I THOUGHT I WOULD.  THE SERIAL NUMBERS ARE 492OPVL, MANUF. ON 8/7/98, AND 492ONSO, MANUFACTURED ON 2/2/99.  *AK

BOTH OF THE NEW MOONEY AIRPLANES WHICH I PURCHASED IN 1998, AND 1999, HAD LEAKKY FUEL TANKS.  THIS PROBLEM CAULES BOTH FUEL AND FUMES TO LEAK INTO THE COCKPIT AND PASSENGER COMPARTMENTS OF THE AIRPLANE POSING BOTH A FIRE, EXPLOSION, AND INCAPICATITION RISK.
TRANSMISSION SUPPORT BRACKETS WERE LEFT OFF TRUCK DURING MANUFACTURING RESULTING IN FLYWHEEL BREAKING AND ENGINE DROPPING.  NLM

AFTER PURCHASE AND SUBSEQUENT TEST DRIVE LOUD NOISES ( SCHEECHING ) AND SHUDERING WAS NOTICED WHILE APPLYING BRAKES. AFTER REPLACING ALL BRAKE SHOES AND TURNING BRAKE DRUMS ( THIS REQUIRED 4 TRIPS TO DEALER ) IT SEEMED TO BE OKAY. ON THE  WAY HOME THE SCREECHING STARTED AGAIN WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES.I TOOK THE RV TO GUARANTY CHEVROLET  AND THEY REPLACE THE REAR BRAKES SHOES SAYING THAT THE DEALER WHERE I BOUGHT THE RV PUT THE WRONG BRAKES ON AND THEY SHOUD BE METALIC INSTEAD OF ASBESTOES. THIS CURED THE SHUDDERING PROBLEM WHILE BRAKINFG BUT I STILL HAVE THE SCHEECHING WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES AT LOW SPEEDS ON THE RIGHT REAR WHEEL. I TOOK IT BACK AND THEY LUBRICATED AND ADJUSTED  THE PARKIND BRAKE CABLE AND IT APPEARED TO THEM TO BE OKAY. BUT AFTER DRIVING A FEW MILES IT STARTED DOING IT AGAIN, AS A MATTER OF FACT IT SEEMS TO HAVE TO WARM UP BEFORE MAKING THE NOISE. EVERY ONCE IN AWHILE IT FEELS LIKE A BRAKE SHOE LOCKING UP AND I AM CONERNED ABOUT THIS HAPPENING ON THE HIWAY.
I HAVE BEEN ADVISED BY THE DEALER THAT I MUST PAY $2,000.00 TO HAVE MY TRANSMISSION REPLACED.  I FEEL A VEHICLE WITH JUST 50,000 SHOULD NOT HAVE THIS KIND OF PROBLEM

(MAKE CURRENT GERMAN MODEL MANY) COULDN'T FIND ANYWHERE ELSE TO SEND THIS.   I'M YOUNG WITH GOOD EYES.  THE NEW XENON (I BELIEVE) LIGHTS ARE A TRUE DANGER!!!!!  THEY ARE ABSOLUTELY EYE PIERCING EVEN IN THE REAR-VIEW MIRRORS.  I'M SURE THEY'RE GOOD FOR THE DRIVER OF THAT CAR, BUT FOR EVERYONE ELSE THEY ARE PAINFUL!  I'M GENERALLY NOT ONE TO ASK FOR GOVERNMENT INTRUSION, BUT THESE THINGS NEED TO BE TONED DOWN AND/OR BANNED BEFORE THEY BECOME TOO COMMON.  I LIVE IN A HILLY AREA AND I HAVE NEARLY HAD ACCIDENTS WHEN A CAR WITH THESE LIGHTS CRESTS A HILL.  OTHER PEOPLE I HAVE SPOKEN WITH FIND THEM JUST AS PAINFUL AND ANNOYING.  THANKS FOR YOUR TIME!!!
ELECTRIC CONTROLLED MODULES FAILED PREMATURELY CAUSING BURNS TO CONSUMER AND PASSENGER FROM EXCESSIVE HEAT, VEHICLE HAS ALSO STALLED ON HIGHWAY IN TRAFFIC.  NLM
FRAME OF TRAVELER TRAILER HAD BROKEN IN HALF. THE METAL HAD GOTTEN HOT & STARTED TO BEND IN THE MIDDLE. THE FRAME WAS ONLY  1/16TH OF INCH THICK WHEN IT BROKE IN HALF.  *AK
WHEN REMOVING MY FOOT FROM GAS, CAR WILL NOT DE-EXCELERATE, EVEN WHEN I BRAKE, CAR WILL RESUME SPEED. TWICE HAS EXCELERATED.  OTHER PROBLEMS ARE COMPUTER RELATED.
THE ONE TOUCH WINDOW OPTION ON THE PASSANGER FRONT SIDE WILL GO UP, BUT AUTOMATICALLY COMES DOWN AGAIN.

TRANSMISSION - OCCASIONALLY POPPED OUT OF 1ST OR 2ND GEAR WHILE ACCELERATING UP INCLINE.  THIS OCCURRED APPROXIMATELY 8 TIMES IN 6 MONTHS.  DEALER IS REPLACING ENTIRE TRANSMISSION.  DRIVER'S WINDOW SWITCH WOULD STICK WHILE TRYING TO RAISE WINDOW.  WINDOW WOULD GO UP AND DOWN.  HAND TO MANUALLY HOLD SWITCH DOWN TO GET WINDOW TO RAISE.  DEALER REPLACED SWITCH.  GAS GAUGE STOPPED FUNCTIONING AS DID ONBOARD COMPUTER ESTIMATION OF GAS MILEAGE.  DEALER REPLACING SENDING UNIT TO GAUGE AND COMPUTER.

REAR VISION IMPAIRMENT: THE 1998 AUDI A8 HAS TWO LARGE HEAD RESTS FOR THE REAR SEAT. THESE HEADRESTS OBSCURE VISION SIGNIFICANTLY TO BLOCK SEEING A CHILD, PET, ADULT OR OTHER OBJECT LESS SUBSTANTIAL THAN ANOTHER VEHICLE. I REQUESTED AUDI MAKE PROVISIONS FOR THEIR REMOVAL SINCE MY ONLY REAR PASSENGER IS MY GREAT DANE DOG. AUDI HAS REFUSED TO ASSIST MY DEALERSHIP IN THEIR REMOVAL. I AM CURRENTLY DRIVING A 19991/2 AUDI A4 LOANER CAR THAT HAS CUT OUTS IN THE UPPER PORTION OF THE REAR SEATS THAT ALLOW THE HEAD RESTS TO "NEST" SUFFICIENTLY TO AVOID OBSCURING REAR VISION. OBVIOUSLY AUDI IS AWARE OF THE REAR VISION PROBLEMS IN ITS LINES, HOWEVER, THEIR REFUSAL TO HELP OR ASSIST MY DEALER IN PROVIDING ME WITH A CLEAR VISION PATH IS SOMETHING I DO NOT UNDERSTAND. MY ISSUE IS CLEARLY SAFETY, HOWEVER, AUDI HAS BEEN TOTALLY NON RESPONSIVE TO ME AND PURPORTEDLY CONTACTS THE DEALER CONCERNING THEIR UNWILLINGNESS TO CONSIDER CHANGES TO PROVIDE ME WITH A CLEAR VISION PATH. BECAUSE OF AUDI'S INTRANSIGENCE IN SEVERAL SAFETY, MY USE OF A $70,000 AND UTILITY OF THIS VEHICLE IS GREATLY DIMINISHED. AUDI DIRECTED MY DEALER NOT TO INSTALL A REAR BUMPER (RADAR/DRIVER ALERT UNIT) ELECTRONIC PROXIMITY DETECTOR THAT PROVIDES THE DRIVER AUDIBLE AND VISUAL WARNING OF OBJECT DIRECTLY BEHIND THE VEHICLE. INTERESTINGLY AUDI IS MAKING AS STANDARD OR OPTIONAL EQUIPMENT FOR THE A8 IN YEAR 2000 AN "AUDIBLE PARKING INDICATOR" FOR MONITORING THE AREA BEHIND A VEHICLE WHILE IN REVERSE. I CANNOT STATE TOO STRONGLY THAT AUDI AMERICA OWES THEIR CUSTOMERS FREE REPAIR OF THE EGREGIOUS DRIVER BLIND SPOTS AND REAR VISION OBSTRUCTION. AUDI MAINTAINS THAT NO PROBLEM EXISTS, WILL DO NOTHING TO AID THE CONSUMER, AND AUDI APPARENTLY DIRECTED MY DEALER NOT TO INSTALL EITHER VISION ENHANCEMENTS (MIRRORS) OR THE AUDIBLE BACK UP PROXIMITY DETECTOR I PURCHASED FOR $350.00. APPARENTLY AUDI'S POSITION TO MY DEALER IS: THE A8 CAR PASSED ITS SAFETY TESTS AS DELIVERED, AND ANY CHANGES WOULD BE UNAUTHORIZED MODIFICATIONS. I SINC
THE TRAILER WE WERE TOWING FISH-TAILED EVEN WITH THE SWAY BAR.  IT HAS A TOO LOW OF A TOUNG WEIGHT AND IS TOP HEAVY.  IT FLIPPED AFTER IT CAUSED US TO GO OUT OF CONTROL.
